This article has multiple issues. Please help improve it or discuss these issues on the talk page. (Learn how and when to remove these template messages)
This article may require cleanup to meet Wikipedia's quality standards. The specific problem is: Needs alphabetizing, pruning of non-notable observances or adding them to Wikipedia articles. Please help improve this article if you can. (June 2018) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. (June 2018) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
(Learn how and when to remove this template message)

The following is a list of notable month-long observances, recurrent months that are used by various governments, groups and organizations to raise awareness of an issue, commemorate a group or event, or celebrate something.

Contents

  • 1 January
  • 2 February
  • 3 March
  • 4 April
  • 5 May
  • 6 June
  • 7 July
  • 8 August
  • 9 September
  • 10 October
  • 11 November
  • 12 December
  • 13 See also
  • 14 References
  • 15 External links

January[edit]

  • Dry January (United Kingdom)
  • Human Trafficking Prevention Month (United States)[1]
  • International Creativity Month
  • Mental Wellness Month[2]
  • National Mentoring Month (United States)[3]
  • Tamil Heritage Month (Canada) [4][5]
  • Slavery and Human Trafficking Prevention Month (United States)
  • Stalking Awareness Month [6]

February[edit]

  • Black History Month (United States and Canada)
  • American Heart Month (United States)[7]
  • Gang Prevention Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Oral Hygiene Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Teen Dating Violence Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Eating Disorder Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Turner syndrome awareness month [8]
  • LGBT History Month (United Kingdom)[9]
  • Cholangiocarcinoma Awareness Month[10]

March[edit]

  • Adolescent Self-Injury Awareness Month (Global)[11]
  • National Athletic Training Month[12]
  • International Black Women In Jazz & The Arts Month[citation needed]
  • Brain Injury Awareness Month[13]
  • National Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month[14]
  • National Disabilities Month[citation needed]
  • Endometriosis Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Hexagonal Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Irish-American Heritage Month [15]
  • National Music in Our Schools Month[citation needed]
  • National Nutrition Month [16]
  • National Social Work Month[citation needed]
  • Women's History Month[17][18][19]
  • Youth Art Month
  • National Cheerleading Safety Awareness Month

April[edit]

  • International Guitar Month
  • National Donate Life Month
  • Autism Awareness Month (United States)
  • Spondylitis Awareness Month
  • National Occupational Therapy Month
  • Black Women's History Month
  • Distracted Driving Awareness Month
  • Parkinsons Awareness Month
  • Financial Literacy Month[20]
  • Jazz Appreciation Month
  • Mathematics Awareness Month[21][22]
  • National Child Abuse Prevention Month[23][24]
  • National Deaf History Month, March 13-April 15[25][26]
  • National Medical Laboratory Professionals Week (NMLPW)
  • National Poetry Month
  • National Volunteer Month
  • Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Month[27]
  • Records and Information Management Month[28]
  • Sexual Assault Awareness Month[29][30][31]
  • Sikh Heritage Month (Ontario, Canada)[32][33]
  • Stress Awareness Month (United States) [34]
  • National Car Care Awareness Month[35]
  • National Fair Housing Month [36]
  • Confederate History Month[citation needed]
  • Sarcoidosis Awareness Month[37]

May[edit]

  • Tourettes Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • ALS Awareness Month (United States)[38]
  • Asian Pacific American Heritage Month[17][39]
  • Better Hearing and Speech Month[40]
  • Borderline Personality Disorder Awareness Month[41]
  • Celiac Awareness Month
  • Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Haitian Heritage Month
  • International Internal Audit Awareness Month [42]
  • Jewish American Heritage Month(USA)[18][43]
  • Lupus Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Domestic Terrorism Awareness Month (Oceania)
  • Melanoma and Skin Cancer Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Mental Health Awareness Month[44]
  • Multiple Sclerosis Awareness Month (Canada)
  • National Arthritis Month
  • National Bike Month
  • National Foster Care Month[45]
  • National Guide Dog Month (2008, 2009)
  • National Mobility Awareness Month
  • National Stroke Awareness Month
  • Neurofibromatosis Awareness Month
  • National Correct Posture Month
  • Cystic Fibrosis Month (Australia and US)[46]
  • National Apraxia Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Brain Tumor Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Pediatric Stroke Awareness Month [47]
  • National Community Action Month

June[edit]

  • African-American Music Appreciation Month[48][49]
  • Alzheimer's Disease and Brain Awareness Month[50]
  • Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia (HHT), also known as Osler-Weber-Rendu Syndrome [51]
  • National Safety Month[52]
  • National Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month
  • Scoliosis Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • Migraine Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • LGBT Pride Month
  • National Homeownership Month [53]
  • National Healthy Homes Month [54]
  • National Caribbean-American Heritage Month[55]
  • Caribbean Cuisine Month[56]
  • PTSD Awareness Month[57]
  • National Dairy Month
  • World Narcissistic Abuse Awareness Day

July[edit]

  • Group B Strep Awareness Month (International)[58]
  • National Cleft and Craniofacial Awareness & Prevention Month[59]
  • National Black Family Month

August[edit]

  • National Hair Loss Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • National Breastfeeding Awareness Month [60]
  • National Immunization Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • National Sales Enablement Month[citation needed]
  • National clock day

September[edit]

  • Classical Music Month
  • Chiari Malformation Awareness Month[61]
  • Life Insurance Awareness Month (US)[62]
  • National Alopecia Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • National Childhood Cancer Awareness Month[citation needed]
  • National CMT Awareness Month (Charcot-Marie-Tooth Disease)
  • National Deaf Awareness Month[63][64]
  • German American Heritage Month, which runs from September 15-October 15 [65] (United States)
  • National Guide Dog Month (US)
  • National Hispanic Heritage Month (US; September 15 to October 15)[17][66]
  • National Honey Month
  • National ITP Awareness Month
  • National Literacy Month
  • National Menopause Awareness Month
  • National Piano Month
  • National Preparedness Month[67]
  • National Prostate Health Month[68]
  • National Recovery Month [69]
  • National Suicide Prevention & Awareness Month
  • Neonatal Intensive Care Awareness Month
  • Pain Awareness Month[70]
  • Polycystic Ovary Syndrome Awareness Month
  • Sepsis Awareness Month[71]
  • Sickle Cell Awareness Month[72]
  • Trucker Appreciation Month

October[edit]

  • Archives Month
  • German American Heritage Month, which runs from September 15-October 15 [65] (United States)
  • Black History Month (United Kingdom)
  • Breast Cancer Awareness Month
  • "International Longevity Month".  (Worldwide)
  • Craniosynostosis Awareness Month
  • Ben 10 Month (South America)[citation needed]
  • Filipino American History Month (United States)
  • LGBT History Month (US and Canada)[73]
  • Muslim heritage month (Canada)
  • National Arts and Humanities Month (United States)
  • National Bullying Prevention Month (US)
  • National Cyber Security Awareness Month[74][75]
  • National Dental Hygiene Month (US)[76]
  • National Disability Employment Awareness Month[17][18][77]
  • National Domestic Violence Awareness Month
  • Dysautonomia Awareness Month
  • National Dyslexia Awareness Month
  • National Family History Month (United States)
  • National Hispanic Heritage Month (US; September 15 to October 15)[66]
  • National Orthodontic Health Month
  • National Pastor Appreciation Month (US)
  • "National Physical Therapy Month". 
  • National Pit Bull Awareness Month[78]
  • National Reading Group Month[79]
  • National Work and Family Month[80]
  • Optical Coherence Tomography Month
  • Polish American Heritage Month
  • Pregnancy and Infant loss awareness month
  • RETT Syndrome Awareness Month
  • Down Syndrome Awareness Month
  • National Crime Prevention Month
  • National Window Covering Safety Month
  • National Cholesterol Month[81]
  • Blindness Awareness Month [82]
  • Spina Bifida Awareness Month[83]

November[edit]

  • National Homeless Youth Awareness Month
  • International Drum Month
  • Mouth Cancer Awareness Month[84]
  • Movember - November events to raise awareness and funds for men's health issues, such as prostate cancer and depression
  • National Adoption Awareness Month[85]
  • National Diabetes Awareness Month[86]
  • National Epilepsy Awareness Month[87]
  • National Novel Writing Month - people from all over the world try to write a 50,000-word novel in a month
  • Native American Indian/Alaska Native Heritage Month[17][18][88]
  • Pulmonary Hypertension Awareness Month
  • Warrior Care Month[89]
  • World Quality Month [90]
  • World Vegan Month[91]
  • National Caregivers Month
  • National Veteran and Military Families Month [92]
  • National Career Development Month [93]

December[edit]

  • Christmas
  • Hanukkah
  • Kwanzaa
  • GDS[disambiguation needed]
